I wont be a repeat customer again.

Called two other CPK restaurants to inquire if they are serving the Roasted Garlic Chicken Pizza, and this location was the only one that was able to provide me with a response of yes without having to speak with a manager. Yes, that means 5 Stars to me! Brentwood and Westwood responded no or said "yes we have the bbq chicken" when they actually did. Many people nowadays don't listen to full inquires but I only had to ask yes and the hostess told me when they started carrying it! I live closer to the Brentwood and Westwood locations but will be glad to drive to Santa Monica. Thank you Santa Monica CPK!!!!

the food was average and the service was quite average. the parking was terrible. the neighborhood at night was quite poor. The parking is terrible here.  Santa Monica appears to have degenerated and deteriorated much over the past 10 to 20 years due to lack of parking.....crime.........homelessness........gangs and rent control...... the landlords do not want to keep up their buildings or houses or apartments or even repair them for major problems due to rent control by the city of santa monica.....the people's republic of socialist santa monica........

Absolutely the worst take out service in town. Slow, late....and no compensation for the wait time or the trouble. And to boot, I tipped them because I paid before they even started working on my order. Poor.

I went here two Saturdays ago and this place was packed. It was about mid afternoon too. The wait was quick tho.. About 15 mins and we where seated.The server came over immediately and asked us what we wanted to drink and about the specials that they had. When he came back with our drinks we ordered our main course. It took about 20 mins for us to get our food, which is okay considering it was a Saturday and it was packed!  Ohhh and the food was good as it normally is at CPK!

I came here for the first time today and was satisfied! The food tasted great and the service was quick. A really quiet and nice environment. The server was excellent! He was extremely helpful and considerate. Will be coming back for sure!

My husband and I had a great experience here! The main reason is because of kellie she's awesome so friendly and attentive she was amazing. The food was also prepared pretty fast and tasted great same as any other cpk but this location made a big impact on me because of the great service. When we go back hopefully we can sit in kellie's section again.

I visited this location yesterday and it was very pleasant. My server, Grant, had a very California attitude ( in a good way). I decided to ask if the Tomato Basil Spaghetti with grilled chicken could still be ordered. My request was obliged. The sauce here was a bit heavier but flavorful. I just added Parmesan cheese. No dessert was ordered, a rarity for me. The ambience was very alive but not noisy. (Very few parties that day.) I would gladly come back.

We have been tote CPK in marina del Rey about a month ago for the first time and loved it, it wasn't greasy, it was super crisp delicious pizza. Last night we decided to get two from out local California Pizza Kitchen. When we brought it home and tasted it we couldn't believe it was the same restaurant chain. It was greasy, soggy and with wayyyy too much salt.  The worst thing is that one of the pizzas was the same one we ordered at a different location. Try should be embarrassed and ashamed at serving us food like that for that price. Disgusting, and we are not coming back here again!! If I want to eat crap like this, I can order Pizza Hut.
Meh. Food was okay, service was good. Salad just seemed fake if that's possible. Pizza wasn't blowing me away. I'd say this is comfortable and  boring choice in dining.

I'm gonna give two stars for the great pizza and zero stars for the weak service. Went here on a Wednesday night and the restaurant seemed pretty slow so there really is no excuse for the weak service. My girlfriend ordered a strawberry mojito and what she got back was a strawberry margarita. Great. We ordered the habanero carnitas pizza and it was delicious but our server didn't offer any parmesan cheese or pepper to go along with our pizza. And what really pissed me off was that our waitress didn't come around to see if we needed anything else. if she would have checked in on us she would have seen that we needed a refill for our waters but she  didn't and we were over there eating the spiciest pizza that CPK has to offer. Overall I'll probably eat here again just because the food is good but I'll probably stop by a 7/11 beforehand and grab something to drink to go along with my meal.

After eating a big meal of Thai food and getting some ice cream, I didn't think I'd be hungry however we spent a good 3 or 4 hours browsing the Barnes and Noble nearby after a while, I was feeling hunger pangs again. We got here about an hour and half before closing. The promenade was mostly empty by this late hour which means so was the restaurant. We were seated quickly in a booth and service is prompt and attentive.  Since it was late at night, I was freezing. I ordered a bowl of their tortilla soup and it hit the spot. Warmed me up and I was ready for the appetizer and the main meal. After quickly browsing, we both decided on the guacamole. It arrived a bit bland and we seasoned it with some table salt. Not bad after that but the portion is tiny. I don't think I'd order this again. I'm a big fan of guacamole and you have to give me more guac than that or give me equal shares of both or none at all. For my main meal, I went with the BLT pizza. It wasn't bad but I probably won't order it again. The chilled lettuce on top cools the whole pizza down which then gives it a weird taste. I like my pizza hot. This is probably a bad idea for a pizza. I do however enjoy their other pizza offerings.  Overall, it wasn't a bad meal. I enjoyed my pizza the next day as leftovers.

My wife and I had been craving some unique pizza and we knew we could find it at CPK. It was very close to our hotel, so that helped in our pizza selection. We got the Taco pizza and thought it was great. It's changed since we had it last. Thinner crust and black beans, though that last one I can't be sure. We haven't been to CPK in a long time since there isn't one close to our house, but the Taco and Pear Gorgonzola pizzas are our favorites.

This is definitely my favorite of the CPK restaurants. The restaurant is always spotless (restrooms included), the staff is super friendly, and we usually get in and out pretty quick. The menu selection seems almost endless.. but not to worry, the knowledgable waiters will help you with any questions you may have about the items.  Pizzas are delicious, but I'm partial to the pastas. I love their fettucine alfredo and shrimp scampi. Yum! Also have awesome drinks. I like the ambiance. My favorite waiter is Sam, he's very friendly, attentive, and keeps my glass full and my table happy. Try and sit in his section if you can :)

Happy new year! We came here on NYE around 7:30 to get a good base in our stomach before the all night binge drinking marathon.  Great decision.  4 guys. We were headed to The Penthouse at the Huntley shortly after around 9:15. It's right across the street, so it worked out perfectly. We were greeted promptly by a cute girl who sat us immediately. We sat in a booth. Very comfortable and relaxed environment. There were actually quite a few families there.  I can't remember our waiters name, but he kicked major butt. He was from Boston and had a very thick accent. Good lookin' redheaded guy.  He playfully bantered with us for awhile and was great at checking on us.  At one point, I even spilled my beer everywhere. I ordered a Samuel Adams Winter Lager on tap. I was telling a story about the time my friends neighbor got cock-blocked by Brian Urlacher and the next thing I know, my beer is all over the floor and table. I wasn't even drunk....haha.  Our waiter was on point. He came right over and got me a brand new beer. He also made a smart ass remark that killed at the table.  We ordered a BBQ Hawaiian pizza and a meat lovers pizza. The pizzas were good, but the portions were very weak. There were four of us. Two pizzas should have been enough. Also, they bring bread to the table, and we only got four pieces of bread. I was still hungry after the meal.  If the portions were bigger, this place would get 5 stars in my book.  Great service is really hard to come by, especially in SaMo, but this place was above and beyond.  PROS: Great service -Relaxed atmosphere and vibe -Quick -Delicious -BREAD! CONS: Terribly small portions I think I'll go back here by myself and eat a pizza by myself.  Enjoy the food and drinks - ask for the dude from Harvard Bar! Best,  Sean
This is a chain.   The food is passable.  The service is nice.  Nothing special - but nothing bad. I enjoy their lunch salads - but I mostly go because it is convenient to my office.

Food good. Service awful. I think that our server Andrea had trouble hearing our order. That was the beginning of the problem. She brought the kids' food out first, good idea, but one was not what kid ordered... Took it back and brought the right one.... Ok. Then brought my food.... Ok.... Much later brought hubby's pizza... Not what he ordered... Took it back... His pizza finally came after we were all finished eating... I could not believe that she charged us for it... But did not want to  bring it up with kids and grandma in tow... Also when we paid, this waitress brought our change in 20's... With all this, we were still doing to leave her a 15 to 20% tip and she even made that hard on us. I think she actually might mean well, she's just a bit off. :(  I love cpk. It's great for families. The original cpk opened in BH when I was a kid... My recent experiences at cpk, are making me lose the love.

Very bad service today!!!! Either the waitress is new or really doesn't know what she's doing... First we got a dish that we didn't order, then my husband got his fish tacos WITH the dressing after I made sure the waitress puts down NO dressing, then he got it with no dressing but without the avocados he requested, and then asked for more salsa which never made it to our table....  She's not getting her tip today that's for sure!

Every time I go to Santa Monica to surf I stop by CPK. I am a big fan of the Spinach Dip and the Thai Chicken Pizza. Surfing, the beaches and CPK make Santan Monica the best city in the country. If you are in town do not waste your time, eat at CPK and you will never regret!
Penny gave us personable and quick accurate five star service I'm a snob and this location consistently  Is on point. Well done PENNY!

Ok, what's with CPK? Over and over their take out services are some of the worse. They have inexperience kids putting take out orders and they are always ssslllooowwww and always forget something. Tonight I place my take out on line to see if this would make it better. No, it didn't help. I think they are unfortunately ob their way out. To bad for the place who brought us pizza like Spago Oh yea they are long gone too.

Heard so much good things about this pizzeria. Not impressed at all. Maybe I would be more satisfied if I didn't hear that many positive feedbacks. My expectations were not satisfied. Not the best place to have pizza. Overall service was good.
Met a friend there for lunch. Great bottle of wine, Hawaiian Pizza, salad, pasta and chocolate desert. the wait staff was very good as well.

Waiter is super friendly and very helpful. Stirred me clear of a drink that was on the not so good side and suggested a Caribbean Sangria. Whichh was pretty awesome. Also got the avocado rolls were pretty great and unique.

Came here with the fam and had a pretty average night.   The food ( Garlic Chicken Pizza and Quinoa Arugula Salad was pretty good...Nothing made us go "Holy Fire that is soo good!" But we were satisfied enough. The service was decent. Again, not amazing... But perfunctory.  In a nutshell: Could've been better, could've been worse. Worth a try? Yeah for sure.

Great food, poor service. And watch out for the bill. The waiter I got, Paulina, doesn't know how to charge correctly. She tried charging my friend double the amount. She didn't even apologize. and it seemed like forever before she came to our table even though the restaurant was nearly empty!
LOVE their pasta, yum!  The only thing I dont like is the decoration, and sometimes the service is a bit bad.

I would say that this is a typical CPK location.  Overall the food is more unique style pizzas like taco pizza (which is really really good) or BBQ chicken pizza, etc.  They also have really good entrees like the tequila lime pasta.  The bread is good so ask for it.  The wait staff is average with no complaints from me.  You can often get a table without a wait.
Had a great experience the service was excellent! The lunch special was perfect! Had the 7" sausage pepperoni mushroom and the spinach salad. It was tasty!
I love CPK. Not sure why it has 3-stars. Good prices, and good food. Definitely get the peach lemonade, it's the best drink by far.

Very happy about this place. Come here often to pick up. Always great service and good value. Free beverage while you wait too. And you can order online which is sooo much better than calling and should be standard at all restaurants! Good job.

This location near the promenade is always busy  The food is unique because there are toppings not normally used for pizza Some of it is good, other dishes not so much Good service but not really authentic italian style pizza Give it a try to see if it is your thing
Below average, uninspiring pizza, cafeteria quality salads... Very disappointing!
Dirty soda machine, rude service to certain cultures. Overpriced for what size pizza we got. Too greasy. Not worth another visit. We could have had better pizza a few shops down the promenade.

I came here in a "I need dinner on a Saturday night and NO I do not have a reservation" type of mood. After they said 15-20 minutes I jumped at the offer. No Buca di Beppo, I am NOT waiting 45 minutes. And not even going to try Fritto Misto after seeing 20 people waiting outside in their plastic patio chairs. The service was attentive for most of the meal. I didn't feel rushed. After searching the menu to find something remotely healthy, I gave up and got the Chicken Tequila Fettucine without Chicken nonetheless. It was decent. Could've had a little more something, but oh well. The Kendall Jackson Chardonnay was my drink of choice and the Red Velvet a la mode is my one true love. So much for eating healthy.

My hs crew and I came here for dinner tonight. After debating over cpk, cheesecake or some other place, the bday girl decided on cpk. We had a newbie serve us. He forgot our bread, my friend had to ask for some. But whatever I dont eat their bread anyways. I decided to be boring and got the og bbq chicken pizza. Ya it was otay. Bday girl got the chicken madiera...she said it was horrible! Horrible i tell ya! Other gals got the garlic chicken pizza and salad. They said it was otay. For dessert we shared the chocolate brownie thing a la mode. That was ok too. So overall, service, food, blah blah was ok.

Do not patronize this restaurant.  This has to be regarded as the evil stepsister to all other California Pizza Kitchens.  I eat at CPK's all over the city.  Enjoy the food and service all the time.  BUT THIS ONE IS BAD.  A half-filled restaurant at 7:30 p.m. should have been the tip-off to turn around and go somewhere else.  Fears where realized when orders were placed and the food arrived lukewarm, unseasoned, and bland.  Salmon was small and overcooked; spaghetti was plain and served with a teaspoon instead of a pasta spoon (We were told the pasta spoons were being washed. Yeeks!). The manager and staff are ill-trained. I am sure they mean well, but they are completely lost when anticipating the needs of a customer.  Initially sat down in a booth that had not been cleaned of debris from the previous diners only to sit in a pool of water that had accumulated from the air conditioner high above the restaurant floor. The manager explained without apologizing, "Oh, the water must be coming from the condenser. Do you still want to sit here?"  Run for the hills!  Second rate people hire third rate people, and third rate people cause restaurants to fold.  I suggest corporate take a close look at this one.

I love this place. They have great food, and great service. They are very friendly here. I love their cheese pizza, salad, tortilla soup, and macaroni and cheese. The only complaint that I have is that their bread should be heated. Otherwise this place is great!

I normally abstain from reviewing chain places unless they stand out for a particular reason.  In this case, I must say that this is one of the worst CPK locations in southern California. I've been here a few times, and each time, there's a certain odor in the air that I finally realized could be either urine or body odor, or both. To top it off, I came here once during a typical SoCal heat wave and the air conditioning was broken! We ordered some drinks (water, beer, mixed drinks) that took for ever to bring. We didn't even bother ordering any food.  In general, I like CPK but I have to say that this particular location could use some new management and an upgrade in utilities. Considering its location near the beach and 3rd Street, they should pay extra attention to ensure that everything functions smoothly. When it's 90 degrees out on a summer Saturday and the place is only half-filled at the height of the day, it speaks volumes on the quality of service one can expect...

i''ve been to a few california pizza kitchen's around greater socal and i generally have no complaints about their food.  today's experience was a little interesting.  My mom's in town visiting so we went up to the 3rd street promenade to check out the scene.  Ending up at the north end of the promenade (and having to make a obligatory stop at hennessy + ingalls bookstore) i noticed cpk there and thought we'd check it out.  For being a non-primetime hour, there seemed to be a few too many people waiting for tables... the host explained they were short staffed and the wait would be approx. 20 mins.  That was cool, we waited.   The shortness of wait staff being the case, it was obvious that the service would be less than satisfactory, and generally was.  However, the main reason for writing this review was for the host at the front door,   I think his name was Taylor.  He was running around trying his best to help those that he just seated as much as possible until their server could make an appearance. Kudos to Taylor for puttin' in the extra effort.

One star for the nice decor, one star for the nice friendly service.  But WTF happened to the pizza and salads in this place?  It was always kind of expensive for pizza and salad, but now - 11.99 for a really blah, bland, boring Cobb salad that really wouldn't have been out of place in a dorm cafeteria.  I haven't been to one of these places in a while, so maybe it was just sticker shock, but it was never that great (points for taking the whole California Pizza idea - that is, put just about any kind of cuisine on top of some thin crust, and it'll be good - running with it, and franchising it), and now - wildly overpriced.   If you've got stock in CPK, I think I'd sell now, if I were you - I think they might have priced themselves right out of their market.

CPK is CPK.  If you've tried it, you know what to expect.  If you haven't tried it, think more "California" than "Pizza".  It is a step above fast food, but it's not fine dining. My favorite entree is the goat cheese and roasted bell pepper pizza.  Welcome to California. This CPK location near the Promenade was able to seat 9 people on short notice for a   when nearby restaurants had long waits.

One star for the consistency of the food.   There are no more stars, people!   This is the worst restaurant service I've ever experienced.  The service is almost non-existent.  It's so bad that I've had to wait 30 mins for someone to even come to our table to take drink orders, over 30mins for cold food that must have been sitting somewhere, and 20 mins to get our check, over 10 mins waiting on the phone for someone to take a takeout order, and over 15 mins waiting for someone to acknowledge customers' presence when they are picking up an order.    Keep in mind that these are all separate occasions.  I've started conversions with other customers who were also waiting about how terrible the service is. Today was the last straw.  I called in an order and had to repeatedly call back before I was not on hold. When I told them that I have been on hold for over 10mins for someone to take my order, the person on the other end said something within the lines of "We're really busy. Maybe you can call back later." and then hung up.   The ONLY reason I have gone back for take out is because I love their salads and sometimes I just crave them.   Now, I understand that they are near the Promenade and they are busy.  But, guess what?!  Almost every restaurant in Boston and New York gets busy during the lunch rush.  In fact, they are even busier than this one.  The difference is that other places don't seem to be chaotic or disorganized.  Who is managing this place?   I will be venturing to Marina Del Rey from now on if I really need my CPK salad.

Yall CPK is tight you hear me? So um the food is OK. I suggest the butter and bread, a pizza, broccoli sun dried tomato, a brownie or sundae, caesar salad, and for drinks either a pepsi or pink lemonade. Sometimes the workers are nice sometimes they're annoying, depends really on who you get. Watch out though, they are realllllly pricey. Oh and their bathrooms are clean.

There's something about CPK that I love.  Kit mentions that their dishes are boring and plain.  Personally, I don't think their dishes are boring. Plain, yes. But not boring.  Their salads, pastas, and sandwiches are actually pretty darn good.  I actually don't like their appetizers and pizzas, which is ironic since it's called California "Pizza" Kitchen and not California "Pasta" Kitchen. Anyhow, although the dishes are plain, I actually prefer that for lunch.  I don't usually go to CPK for dinner, but for lunch, plainer pastas are a bit better.  I'll wait till dinner to get my elaborate sauced/spiced/seafood pasta. The only problem I have with this place is the service.. I have never actually received good service at a CPK.  Most of the time, the service is bad and snooty.  I actually have a friend who used to work at a CPK and she told me about the rigorous classes/tests that they make all of the servers go through before they get the job 100%.  And all of this other stuff.. It just surprises me that they make their employees go through so much and yet, I don't get good service ever.  I rather have a server who is nice compared to a server who knows what every ingredient is in a pasta.

The food tastes wonderful, the seating is comfortable.  Service is just average, they've raised prices so food is expensive now, and it's kinda loud inside with lots of echoes.  Ambience is just OK, lots of families and older people in the clientele.  Parking is very difficult, parking garage on 2nd street for $3 is the best choice.  Other CPK locations are better.

Good food! I ordered the Field Greens salad, the half caesar salad and the tostada pizza to go. I did not realize that they did not have curbside service. So I waited in the alley next to them and someone came out and gave me my food and change. I would not get the tostada pizza to go. I would only get it if I was going to eat there. Something about the time from the restaurant to home just did not go over well with the pizza. Everything other than that tasted really good and I would do take out from here again.

Very tolerant of kids - great restaurant for a family outing with little ones.  Love the soups and appetizers. Pizza is delicious. I love it that they offer pasta + edamame for kids instead of the regular deep fried chicken fingers crap other places serve.
This place was really good and consistent. I  had the BBQ chicken salad which was very good. My son got the BQQ chicken pizza and loved it! It is a excellent family joint.

Just updating my last review.  Took my 9 yo along with his friends after we spent a few hours at the Pier.  The service has improved dramatically.  quick, friendly, and clean.  whatever you're doing works!

This is a place I have always enjoyed, but today, it was bad, service stunk. To me, it appeared that the kitchen and servers were understaffed and overwhelmed. Our server was not very attentive. Our party of 5 people arrived before noon and the place was not very busy. Drink orders were taken and delivered but then NOTHING. It was as if we didn't exist. When we finally placed our orders two were screwed up. One in our party got his food 20 minutes after the rest of us. One very nice thing is because of the screwup they comp'd his meal.  Classy but it would have been better without the delay. Jerry s
I think CPK is alright. The food is dependable but just okay. I've always had extremely friendly service.

I normally stay away from chain restaurants but CPK is the exception.  The food is consistently good, soups, salads, pizzas, all above average to excellent.  The service is great.  We had a very nice waiter who was attentive and not pushy.  The manager came around to make sure everything was taken care of.  Drinks were refilled regularly.  It's as good as it gets.

This CPK is not unlike most others. The menu is the same, the food is delicious (albeit mostly bad for you), and the service is a crapshoot. This particular location was able to accomodate my large party, though, very quickly. This party included two infants, and the waitress we had was diligent not to place things in their immediate reach. A lot of waiters don't consider a baby's natural tendency to grab EVERYTHING in front of them, so it's nice to get a waitress who actually thinks about that kind of thing. The upside to this CPK is that it's near 3rd Street Promenade and also within walking distance of the Pier, but that's also its downfall, since there are always quite a number of homeless people out front. I don't mind the homeless at all (they're people too, after all), but depending on your luck they can be friendly or completely out of their minds. I've encountered a couple of the crazy ones near this CPK, so keep that in mind.

This review is solely placed on TAKE OUT ORDERS... Dining In... I love CPK,  but if you order to go.. it is a fing rip off. All the food is 1/52369521541 the size and ridiculously over priced. My co-workers and I placed a 200 dollar order today. I was p to the iced when we opened the bags to find that they had forgotten to include the lettuce for the lettuce wraps.... thats why you work at CPK.  When I called and asked them to deliver it they said, "No"... it's a 2 minute drive - that I shouldn't have to make. We ordered dessert and returned for the orphaned lettuce. The D Bag at the register didn't even give me a ten cent discount.... I personally dislike him and hope he trips on his way home. I don't want him hurt.. but a scraped knee would be nice.  F YOU TAKE OUT TEAM! F YOU!
Frequently come here with a large group and several children. Service is always speedy and servers are incredibly kind.  Thumbs up.

The food was good yes but I will return here for Scott!!! His service was amazing.  He was sweet and very sexy!  HIs customer was the best I have ever had.  He came back to check on us frequently and called us by our first name.  I will continue to go back just to see him!!!
Pretty much what you would expect from CPK.  The food was decent, the service was decent.  Not the most impressive place, but not bad either.

Average pizza, good service, and slightly better than average prices.  We only came here because my buddy works there so we had the hook up.  I don't think I would come here if I didn't know someone who worked here.  There are so many other better places to eat that don't use below average ingredients.

We have been here multiple times. The food is consistent and served in a decent amount of time. The staff is very friendly and let us use the restroom once for my 8 month old daughter even when I told them we were not dining there. Overall, nice place to hang out in Santa Monica.Not to mention, it is open fairly late.

What a wonderful place to eat. The selection is really amazing. My wife and I went here for dinner and the food was very delicious. I had the Fish Tacos and my wife had the Chopped Chicken Salad. Both meals were great. There are so many other things on the menu that look good, so we will definitely go back to try some more.
Wonderful accommodations, absolutely nice wait staff.

Typical family franchise restaurant. Lots of kids (in fact every table had at least 2 kids), Uninspired food (pizza, pizza, sandwich, pizza, sandwich), big menu selection (to make them seem inspired with their food offerings), and very lackluster service. You first wait a bit to be seated, then wait a bit to have a waiter come and greet you, and wait to get your drink. Then you'll wait.. and wait... and wait.. to get refill. See the pattern here?  Ordered the CPK standard:  the original BBQ chicken pizza, and the new sandwich, Chicken salad sandwich with cranberry and walnut. They taste ok. Taste like food that is prepared the same way, 100 times a day, and go thru the same mundane assembly line. The sandwich was more saliva-inducing than the pizza to me. Cranberry gave a nice tart balance and walnut provided the crunchy texture it needed. Too little chicken i feel. I had it with the herb focaccia, which was well toasted. As a side, i chose a szechwan slaw. Dressing on the cabbage was vinegar-soy sauce-ginger base. It wasn't bad. Needed something to it though. So my beef was with the waiter. He was smiley and overly friendly (sometimes phoney?) when we arrived. Got us our drinks (just iced tea mind you).. first round. Refill never came. In fact he was MIA the rest of the night. Another waiter brought out our food, and after waiting for 15 min to get our glasses refilled, i had to flag down a different waiter and told him ours has been missing and all we wanted was iced tea. No problem, this one refilled it in a jiffy. Our waiter turned around the corner (after being gone for a bit) and saw our tea refilled by someone else, fearing his tip is in jeopardy I think, came over and said "Oh i totaly would have refilled that! i wanted to give you guys new tea". Yea right. You didn't even once walked by/ peeked at/ checked in our table. Your 6th sense told you? So finally, check time. That took 10 more minutes because he was busy showing fellow waitresses his iphone (pics?) and giggling in the corner. Waiting tables at CPK, dare i say, is not hard. There isn't a lot of wine knowledge to learn, nothing to flambee table side, nothing to cut in front of you. Just take the damn order, turn the ticket to kitchen, and make sure drinks are refilled. Too much to ask for, apparently. I waved at him one last time and he then remembered about our check. Gave the standard 20%. I know...I know.. i have the worst Asian guilt complex. lol

I've visited this location twice and both times, the food was pretty mediocre compared to other CPK locations (such as the one in Santa Anita, which I frequently venture to).  The first time was with a boyfriend at the time and we were seated all the way in the back.  And that's all I remember, haha, since that was in early 2007. The second time was last week.  We waited roughly around 10 minutes which wasn't bad and was seated pretty close to the television mounted near the bar, but too bad the Laker game was over by the time we sat down.  I don't remember our server's name, however, I do remember he was from Oklahoma because his name tag had "Oklahoma" written underneath his name and I had asked him if that's where he really was from.  He was friendly at first but throughout the night he would disappear for long periods of time. I forget what he did but he was just really inattentive and he even rushed us for the bill.  We were playing card games and he said that we could hang out for as long as we wanted too as long as we paid the bill first.  Uhh, what?  We paid the bill and one of our party members went to the restroom and overheard our server in the back loudly and angrily complaining to another server about how he's always the first to arrive on his shift and how he's always the last to go home or something.  Very unprofessional. Speaking of unprofessional, while we were waiting for a table, the Laker game was still going on.  A lot of diners cheered loudly when Lakers made the winning shot, along with a few other servers.  The hostess who was right next to us, said to herself with attitude (but loudly enough for us to hear), "Yeah, cheer again, if you don't want to keep your job." What's up with all the rude and unprofessional employees?
Exactly what you would expect--reliable food with reasonable service.  Chicken Fettucine Alfredo is delicious as are the salads.  Kids like the pizza.

As far as chain's go this place is better than most. I am eternally looking for a place that has a good weekday post gym dinner salad around $10 that I can just drop in and pick up and CPK comes close.  I usually order their Thai Crunch salad and it ends up being around $15 after tax and tip (not sure why I feel the need to tip since I am picking it up).  I won't really comment on their pizza since I think it is embarrassing that people all over the world now associate their pizzas as California's take on Pizza. Note to the rest of the world: NOT ALL CALIFORNIANS LIKE TO PUT AVOCADO'S, TOFU, AND CARROTS ON OUR PIZZA. I think Abbots Pizza Co is a lot more representative of the locals taste in pizza.

Food is just like every other CPK.  Same quality, some items are very good while others are bland.  I had the roasted peppers, eggplant with goat cheese pizza and it was delicious.  I'd gone with about 20 others from work, so there was a lot of sharing, and those around me also thought this was the best one.  Another favorite of mine is the pears and Gorgonzola, but it's a bit too sweet for lunch sometimes. Service was decent, but hey forgot to bring out the bread.  But with our big crowd, I guess it's excusable. The wait, also was quite quick considering they had to sit 22 people at 12:30 on a Friday afternoon. Would definitely go back again!
I always get either the chicken waldorf salad or the 5 cheese and fresh heirloom tomatoes and basil pizza.  Soooo good!  Never a disappointment!

It only seemed fitting to get CPK whilst in California.  And although I can be a bit of a pizza snob - I think Chicago style is really the best, but I am more than willing to let other pizza styles compete for my taste bud's alliance. California is quite big on their salads - about half of my colleagues opted for a salad instead of pizza!  This is an alien concept to me.  Really?  Salad over pizza - odd.  I ordered the Greek pizza - I feel like their flavors contradict what my preconceived notion of what pizza IS; however, I will happily sample anything in pizza format. So my Greek pizza was a "healthy" alternative considering all the indulgences from earlier in the week.  I was super pleased with the results.  It was like having a Greek salad (minus the lettuce) atop my lightly cheesed pizza.  Super good pizza and real attentive service.  Thoroughly enjoyable experience.  Kinda pricey, but so is all of California.
workers move at a turtle's pace. food doesn't taste as fresh and my party and i had to wait a ridiculous amount of time in order to be seated--even though the place was half empty. never again.

I try to avoid tourist traps but a friend of mine was in town and had a craving for cpk. Showed around 8PM Saturday, March 22....and we wait for 20 minutes...no big deal. My first problem comes when I make my order and the waitress suggests another sauce...she swears this sauce is better and that a friend of hers loves it. So I went with it...said I could change it if I did not like it...good deal...We get our appetizers and not more than 5 min later our main courses comes out....fast! in fact way too fast for me...by the way did I mention I had ordered soup? where's my soup? it came out towards the end of my main course....geez...and a friend had ordered a drink and they had put the wrong syrup, the waitress had said the bottles are the same colored and they put the normal flavored instead of coconut flavored...I'm fine with waiting, I'm fine with messing with my food, but please don't mess up my drink. I'm going to stand up next time one of my friends wants to eat there, they'd have to drag me in.

Ok, so I get that people want different things for their pizza.  I can be open to different size crusts, various toppings and can branch out and go for a sauceless pizza.  I thought getting pizza here would be a no-brainer, they have pizza in the title.  I was deeply disappointed.  I did pizza takeout.  The crust tasted sweet like a pastry and the sauce was sweet like sugar.  My boyfriend got a salad and it was meh.
Hawaiian bbq chicken pizza is my favorite.  The service was pretty goodm but could have been better.  I recommend going to this CPK at a less crowded time. Otherwise this is a great place.
This place always meets my standards. From their uinque salad selections to there amazing thin crust pizzas, you really can't go wrong with a nice lunch from CPK!!

This place is quite extraordinary.  They consistently (and we are there almost every day) deliver a great meal and a reasonable price.  And the service is consistently pretty good overall.  They also do a great job on the take-out service.

Food is good.  It doesn't really melt in your mouth but it is enjoyable and fills you up.  Had the artichoke spinach dip, hawaiian bbq chicken pizza, and the new baja fish tacos.  They were all fairly good.  Waiters are very attentive... maybe little too much.  We were asked how our food was probably every 5-10 minutes.

This CPK or all CPKs overall are so over-rated.  It is a family-friendly environment but come on, their dishes are boring, plain, over or under-cooked, and expansive.  $12 to $15 for a mediocre salad or pizza for one person just not gonna work.  You can spend that kind of money for a salad at any really good restaurant.  Anyway, I am not a big fan of chain restaurants like chilli's, TGI or all that.  I found them lack of characteristic and profit-oriented.

compared to other california pizza kitchens i have been to i would have to say that this one is not that good in comparison.  however, it is always dependable and you always know what you are going to get.  no suprises here and the food is consistent.

the irony of salad on pizza is enough to get me to come back here. the so called diet friendly greens on one of the most notorious fatyy foods, i just keep imaging a development meeting with an executive asking "how can we get girls to order the higher priced items" answer "well maybe if we take the stable of their diet, the salad and apply it to other dishes..." anyhow the main reason this place gets 4 stars is that its close to the promenade without being on it. that way you have the option to go further into the crowd infested area or just a quick visit to the arch/art bookstore next door. the staff is friendly, although many of them are highly skilled in rushing you. Wednesday nights are packed full (a lot of child custody settlement these days result in guys getting their kids on wed nights and sundays and well the place is kid friendly, bright and well light interior, and you can hear each other over the crowd) but i like quirky things like that.

Last week in Hawaii I was @ their Kahala branch. I had their Thai Crunch salad. This week, ordered the same dish, just a different branch.  Though instead of waiting 60-90 minutes we (my P.E. teacher friend and I) got a bit of a runaround. We walked in and requested a low volume table in order to carry on a conversation. Near the front window we noticed an empty table.  We asked the hostess if we could sit there, being the quieter area than the rest of the restaurant.  She paused and said "no, there's already 8 tables assigned to that waiter, sorry."  She suggested sitting at a table by the bar, what? That was noisier. She paused again, then said "there's tables in back." Walked back, sat down, sniff sniff, unpleasant odors  (near the restrooms).  Back up to the front again. Asked her for an open table where we could carry on a conversation. She said "walk around, find a table, I'll have someone follow you." Scored a table in the middle of the restaurant, a huge booth.  My P.E. teacher friend said "we'll have a half order of Thai Crunch salad, both lime and cilantro + peanut dressings, chicken on the side, extra cilantro please."  She mentioned if the waiter had any ideas about low fat, non fat salad dressings, to please see what he could do.   Our waiter (who apologized for the wait) brought out the Thai Crunch salad, accompanied by a couple of vinegar based dressings. The salad was refreshing, cold and crunchy.  Minus 2 stars for the hostess putting us through the wringer on our request for a decent table/seating arrangement. I couldn't agree with the reviewer "Sadao B."  more "they are a little slow on getting to your table" and "the food, very good and precise."

I am a fan. Hadn't been in years, didn't know what to expect. The boyfriend and I went on a whim. Our service was excellent. The food was great. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.  I hope when you go, you get Leah as your server. She was awesome

We went for dinner last night and one of us is a vegetarian and also gluten intolerant. Their gluten free menu for veggies is pretty limited and she ordered the margherita pizza which was about the only choice. The manager, Jake, found out and came over to us, explained their gluten free guidelines  and designed a special pizza for us and told the chef exactly how he wanted it prepared. It came out beautiful and delicious. Recommend this location.

Ive eaten here a few times, the service is a little slow but everyone is friendly and the food is.....well cant say all that much about it.  Being a chain you can get the same thing of same quality here just like you can there. The wait staff is quite handsome but little standoffish, i wouldnt flirt, the vibe is very heterosexual.

Do you enjoy decent service and moderately attentive/intelligent waiters who don't leave you sitting at your table for up to 40+ minutes without so much as a status update regarding your food? Does it irk you when you watch patrons seated a good 20 minutes after you beginning to eat their meals while you sit, staring at your table  and wishing you'd gone anywhere else? Do you take offense when you ask for something simple, such as the check, and your waiter decides that he has better things to do? If so, avoid the CPK on Wilshire. If you decide to give it a try anyway and you're feeling extra masochistic/want to enjoy your meal with a side of all-consuming rage, ask for Leonardo, the worst server in the history of chain restaurant dining. My coworkers and I are partially to blame, I suppose. We've gone to this location more than a few times for our Friday group outings and we've always known the service has only barely toed the line of being passable. Perhaps we grew TOO comfortable with the location, however, as the service last time should've been a tip (something the waiters at this location rarely deserve) to never come back. 90 minutes to churn out salads and a pizza? In fairness, everyone has a bad day and since we'd become something like "regulars" at this CPK, we returned, promising to give it another chance. Never again. Leonardo, Leonardo, Leonardo... How can I begin to describe your rude, off-putting demeanor, ineptitude, and generally horrendous service? As a timeline, we arrived on 06/28/13 at 12:05 to a nearly empty restaurant and waited about 10 minutes as he ran around looking like a chicken with his head chopped off. After taking our orders, we waited. And waited. And waited. Around 12:40, we finally managed to flag him down and he said that the restaurant had been flooded with to-go orders and to be patient. Well, that might be a decent excuse if the patrons who'd been seated 15 minutes after us hadn't already begun eating. We asked him to bring our checks with our meals (if they ever came) because we had to get back to the office. We even left the credit cards out for him so it could be a quick exchange. Yet, when our food came, there were no checks. In fact, we had to BEG for him to bring us our bills and that prompted a very rude, "HOLD ON, I'M GETTING TO IT!", complete with a dismissive wave of the hand. Keep in mind, we asked for the checks around 12:40 and it was now 1PM. When he finally decided he couldn't find anymore excuses to ignore us, he took our cards and disappeared again, casually walking around and taking NEW orders rather than going to the cash register, which it turned out was also too much for him to handle. Since I'm being thorough, I guess I should also mention that when he brought us CPK's ongoing promotional "Thank You Cards", he threw them at us so disdainfully that they landed in a graceless pile on a plate, nearly splashing one of us with a bright pink sauce. I'm not entirely certain, but I believe that when your service is already as poor as Leonardo's, you should at least make an effort to preserve the few pennies that you've earned of your tip. I finally couldn't take it anymore and had to complain to the manager, who was, in my mind, the one redeeming part of this lunch venture (and the only reason this place deserves the 1 star that I'm giving it). If the rest of the staff at this restaurant had 1/1000000 of the professionalism as the nice Polish manager, whose name I don't know, I might come back. As it is, even with the free meal coupon, I will NOT be returning to this location because it isn't worth the horrible taste this branch leaves in my mouth. CPK on Wilshire, do yourself a favor before you lose all your regular patrons: fire Leonardo--heck, fire your entire current lunchtime wait staff, they're all equally bad--and hire people with a basic understanding of working in the food service industry. Actually, even a pack of monkeys might be better.

It's a chain..I had their Chicken Milanese and perhaps my expectations were too high, but it was quite bland. Honestly they fried 3 chicken breast and topped it with salad. Sorry I could have done that at home... I'll stick with the pizzas next time

It was what I expected from CPK. The service was nice but we came in at a slow time.  The location was clean and the seating was comfortable.  We had a pizza and a pasta. It was a lot of food for two people and had to get a box. They were both very nice. I would come here again.

This is one of the better CPK's I have been to.  The wait was not too shabby and the service was better than slow.  The food is always the same, except that this time it came to our table somewhat cold.  Though my friend was semi-okay with her soup being cold, I was not.

This place is usually very busy, I guess we just got lucky or something and our service was not only fast, but very friendly. Food was cold, but great tasiting, we didn't care for the new bread or olive olive they served with it instead of butter. Thank you Pamela for going behove and beyond, we hope we get you as our waitress everytime we go in.

My office ordered lunch for 6 people. We had one of our reps pick it up. We ordered 4 salads with lots of extra dressing requests. When I ordered everything over the phone, the gentleman that helped me was great. He repeated my order back and it was perfect.  When we got the food at the office we were short 6 dressings. Big problem especially since the missing dressing was for the boss.  I called to inform them of the problem and they told me they were going to send a guy out to deliver them. Half hour later we finally got the dressings, but by that time, we were practically done with our lunches. I could have walked down to the restaurant and come back to the office faster than that.  If it was me managing the restaurant I would have delivered the dressing with a complimentary dessert or a coupon for something on our next trip, but nothing.  I love the food here, but the customer service was horrible, and that is why I'm giving them 2 stars.

Working in the area, CPK is one of my go-to lunch spots. The service is always prompt, drink refills are a-plenty, and the food is consistent. When ordering, I tend to stick with the pizzas or sandwiches. The chicken salad sandwich is great, and the tortilla soup is amazing (comes with a sandwich).  My only complaint, being lactose intolerant, is the fact that they don't offer pizza's with soy cheese. Yes, I know CPK is a chain, but the location IS in Santa Monica after all. Given how many vegan/vegetarian restaurants are in the area, you'd think they'd get the hint. I will add, however, that when I asked my server last time why they didn't offer soy cheese she responded that they have a customer who actually brings his own cheese in and the chefs will make his pizza with it. Boom! I'm gonna try that next time. Overall - great casual spot for lunch/dinner.

This is the biggest CPK I've ever seen. Granted, I've been to only a couple, but... pretty spacious! Our waiter was a nice enough fellow, but for some reason his jokes left me pretty irritated with his service. Maybe I was just in a mood as I'd been up earlier than usual today. Anyway, I ordered the fire roasted chile relleno, which was delicious with its blend of chicken, cheese, beans, avocado salsa, and other delights, but small in proportion to the $11 cost in my opinion. It fell just short of being filling. I thought it'd be large enough to count as an entree, but really it seemed more to me as an appetizer. Perhaps it's just my native Texan-ness speaking here.

A few nights before I went to an expensive Italian restaurant nearby. It was 3 times the cost and really not worth it. So, after a tiring day at work, I said lets go somewhere that I can enjoy a beer and decent pasta.  I went here twice in one week because AJ runs a friendly bar. He attracts a lot of regulars I found out. One of them gave me a piece of the key lime pie when I said, I'll have to try that one night. Decent good food, nice beer selections and a great bartender gets me back always. I miss Santa Monica.
Great food and great service I defiantly recommend it! I am giving four stars because it is hard to find a parking other than that this place is great!

The pepperoni pizza here is great just a bit on the oily side. The penne pasta was really good although we did ask for no chicken and they served it with chicken, but it was totally cool and they let us have it with no extra charge. I liked the opened space plan and overall had great time, will come back again (:

Most California Pizza Kitchens seem to do pretty well, but this one was pretty empty when we went (granted, it was a weeknight).  Still, I walked by it later on a weekend afternoon and it was very empty again. CPK menus are the same no matter where you go (pizzas, pastas, salads, and a small number of sandwiches).  Almost all of their dishes are below $20 (with many below $15) so its pricing is comparable to other chains.  I am not really a big fan of their pizza.  I do not like the crust and for some reason, the pizza often does not seem hot enough.  I usually go for their pastas, which are okay (depending on what you get).  Over the last few years, they have started to add entrees such as crab cakes and salmon though I feel these entrees are not worth the extra cost. The complimentary bread is not the best bread out there, but I ate it up all the same.  It is a simple sliced French bread, and it does not take on butter that well as it tears the bread apart. Some of their pastas are small like the Portobello mushroom ravioli (which I like).  I wanted something a little more filling so I opted for the Kung Pao Spaghetti with Chicken.  The spaghetti had some heat to it, which was good, and it was seasoned right overall.  The spaghetti was cooked right.  They really skimped on the chicken; I think CPK is often stingy with the proteins (on pastas), which is a little frustrating given that they usually charge extra for proteins (chicken, shrimp).  In the chicken's place, there was an inordinate amount of peanuts in the pasta. For dessert, my friend and I both went with the tiramisu.  I like their sticky toffee pudding with ice cream, but it looks like it is no longer on the menu.  Their tiramisu had a good espresso taste and was moist and flavorful.  All of their desserts include the calorie count now, which I imagine would definitely scare many away. While the food was good for what it was (3 stars range), the service was not that great.  Our waiter was friendly, but he seemed to disappear for long stretches of time.  Getting our dessert menus, putting in our dessert order and getting our check took a lot longer than it should have.  A lot of Yelpers have commented (not necessarily on this place) how they are quite surprised when service is so bad and slow when places are not busy (they fret about how bad the service would be if the place was really busy). However, what I have noticed recently is that several empty places are having slow service.  I think with restaurants being less busy, employees now may have more time to socialize with other employees, which can lead to some slow and inattentive service during non-peak times. I would say most CPKs are 3 stars.  They have a pretty varied menu so there are definitely some lackluster dishes offered at CPKs.  But when I stick with what I know I like there, the food is usually okay and serviceable.  Prices are reasonable too.  The portions are not overly big like many chain places out there, but I actually prefer the smaller and more manageable portions. The food at this CPK was decent and comparable to other CPKs, but the service was not as good.  Since this part of Santa Monica has a lot of interesting and worthwhile non-chain places, CPK would definitely not be my first or even second choice (though CPK is less expensive than those non-chain places).  If you are looking for reasonably priced sit-down food at 3rd Street Promenade, this CPK may be worth a shot.  Hopefully, our slow service was an anomaly. There is a nearby parking structure (a block or so east of CPK) that is free for the first several hours.

This is one of the few remaining decent, family-friendly restaurants remaining in this part of Santa Monica, and for that alone it's worth 5 stars. I'm a little bored with the menu options, but that's just because I've been here so many times. The service is usually good, and as a dad who usually eats here with my three kids, I appreciate the fact that they have large bottles of beer (22 - 25 oz).

Pizzas are big and there are plenty of flavors! Really hits the spot after a fun day at the beach and long walk around Third Street, but it is a bit expensive for a pizza place, since there are a ton of cheaper ones around SaMo.

Went here yesterday, with some friends. Our waitress Kellie was very friendly and attentive to our needs. She did a great job. As a matter of fact I always experience great customer service at every CPK that I go to. I digress, I ordered the fried mac n' cheese things, and they weren't as good as previous times trying them. The mac n' cheese seemed a little cold inside. However I did order the vegetarian & eggplant pizza. It was my first time trying it. And let me tell you... That pizza is magnificent. A must try. I like CPK not my favorite pizza place, but the ingredients always are fresh and it's a nice change of pace from most pizza places.

I love CPk! Best restaurant ever. I've been coming here for years and always get the tostada pizza and oh, my son gets the kids Mac and cheese! It's a yummy choice for grown ups too!:):)  Amazing service always! And don't leave without getting the tiramasu!!
Awful service, all through, enough people standing around chatting , but not enough to help our server clear and bring items.  Usually Love this spot and this location but tonight they failed us ‍

My wife and I randomly had a day off and decided to make the most of it. We figured it was going to be busy as heck today but still took a chance with CPK.  We lucked out getting here early and we're pleasantly surprised about the $35 special for Valentine's Day so we decided why not.  Our waiter Thomas was exceptional! Great customer service, great attentiveness to what we wanted and even gave some amazing recommendations. He was all around an ideal person to assist us during dinner. I can definitely say he made tonight a very special night since we don't usually have days off like this. Food was amazing! The bbq chicken pizza and Kung Pow spaghetti was phenomenal! Overall tonight's dinner was nothing less than marvelous.   Thank you for making tonight one for the books! Definitely coming back here and hope Thomas is working then too! :)

location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: I love California pizza kitchen. The pizzas are delicious and I can tell the ingredients are of high quality. I've always like this pizza chain and feel strongly about it. My favorite Pizza is the BBQ chicken. My son and I love it.

This is my favorite dinner spot every time I come here to Third street promenade. Yes, it's a chain, and yes there's many but this spot had not only the nicest people but I swear they have the best food and what more can I ask for since it is also right by the beach, like a block away. I've always ordered the BBQ chicken pizza but today I ordered the Pesto penne multigrain and it was amazing. The ONLY negative is for $3 extra, I really had hardly any chicken and let me tell you, I like my chicken! I think I only got about three super tiny pieces I seriously almost contemplated bringing back the order or asking my server but they were so nice, I kept my mouth shut this time. And despite the long wait time for my mom to get her strawberry refresher, it really wasn't bad. I love coming here. Highly recommend.

I ordered a salad to go & even pretipped them.  The cook made it wrong twice.  The guy making sure the order was corrected properly & the cook were making comments where they were visible to me.  So unprofessional.  Do your job right & be apologetic when you screw up instead of making the customer feel like they're wrong.

If you have any dietary restrictions, you had better check online yourself before going there and plan out what you will be ordering. Our waiter knew NOTHING. Not only that, but he wouldn't stay around long enough for us to ask all our questions so that we could place an order. Every question, he kept running off and saying he will be right back. He would disappear for minutes at a time. One in our party has a vegan diet. Another one has food allergies. We asked if eggs are used in any bread or pizza dough for the vegan. He said ALL of their dough and pasta contains eggs. How can that be? I asked him to ask the manager. I know eggs are not used in pizza dough and most pasta. He comes back to confirm that YES, ALL THE DOUGH AND PASTA CONTAINS EGGS. At this point, I'm totally confused. Our vegan settled on a salad and because of his lack of knowledge, I'm thinking I need to order a la cart so I can put together an allergy free meal for my kid. I asked him what vegetables they have for side dishes. Instead of answering me, he said, he'll be right back. He throws an incomplete dietary guide on the table for me to look through and takes off. I look at it. It only had calorie counts on the main dishes and not the ingredients or even side dishes. I had enough. It's been well over 15 minutes of back and forth with him and we didn't have any answers to our questions. We literally could not order anything or make any headway. We had no choice but to leave because we could not get serviced. We went to another restaurant a block away and their staff was knowledgeable and attentive. Everyone was able to eat. When I got home, I opened their complete dietary guide online. It states, All pizza dough can be used to make vegan pizza. It even gives examples how. All pasta can be used. It does show that the dough and pasta shares equipment, but it doesn't actually contain the eggs. Additionally any Gluten free dough is certified and vegan so it doesn't share any equipment. Why was this so difficult? It's not everyday we can get our family together to go out, so this really ruined our night. It could have been so simple if this waiter would have been better trained and stuck around to finish our order.  We have been going to this particular restaurant since it opened. It had a rough patch with service, but got it together after the remodel. Until this last time we came. Looks like they are heading back to their old ways. Train your staff better and hire people who want to help and be of service. More and more people have dietary restrictions for one reason or another. It can be food allergies, or health or lifestyle or newly developed intolerances in highly allergic people. Your menu states you can accommodate, but your staff doesn't know how to answer questions to help people work around the menu.
this cpk went downhill as well. our waitress screwed up our bills about 3-4 times. She disregarded one of our guests when he asked for water. Just terrible! i dont think i will be coming back
Too much corn in Tortilla soup, consistency was too pasty, reminiscent of baby food: 3 stars for taste, but not enough crunch

Came here with family and friends over the weekend cause someone's kid REALLY wanted CPK and here's the funny part I'm on a diet! I don't want this crap! let me begin to say this place is not, I REPEAT NOT! DIET FRIENDLY! Ok, Here's my rant....you ready? I ordered a Caesar salad. Okay I know who the hell orders a salad at a "pizza joint" lol but that was really sad salad plus I said no dressing but they still brought it on the side, what a way to save money I'm sure your managers are real proud! Also the lettuce you served was dead had no life in it, my fork couldn't even stab it properly had to use the scoop method on your lettuce! Lol That's just sad...so here's the main reason why I'm writing this, your salad menu states you can add grilled chicken breast, not chopped chicken breast or sliced chicken breast so when my food comes it's sliced/chopped whatever the hell you name it. Here's a heads up I'm a not a child and I'm not stupid, that one chicken breast and you guys charged me for two I thought I'd just write it up here and let everyone know what a half ass job your location is serving, I even asked the waitress if that's two breasts and she insists that it was one. I'm not gonna make a scene like my cousin did for his chicken dish he had sent back cause it tasted like fish literally didn't even taste like what a damn bird should...let's just face it the food sucks here even the pizza! it's flatter then a piece of paper and WAY too greasy...no wonder I stopped going to these crappy chain locations and decided to eat at all the local places, and here's a big reminder I am never gonna let a little rugrat chose where they want to eat, she got chicken nuggets and fries from this place @;$ck!
The bread is bombayyyyyyy! Shout out to the bread!  Also, if you happen to be vegan, try the California veggie without cheese!
I went there before they close, the service was like I totally understand they really wanted to go home. Cus it was really bad

On the whole a solid, unexciting, reasonably priced meal. The pizzas are good, though not great. The bbq chicken was the best one we tried. I did love their tortilla soup which was hearty and wholesome and handily comes in 3 sizes so you can order appropriate to your hunger level. The wine selection is safe and average, middling even. Some safe Californians by the glass etc. A small complaint was none of the cocktails are priced on the menu so it's hard to know what you are ordering. So I didn't. The dining room has a somewhat tinny coldish vibe, more suited to summer evenings than the current wintery temps. The service was decent, friendly eager to assist wait staff and hosts. This place is fine, I wouldn't scramble to recommend it and it's not special but it's a good safe bet for some casual eats in Santa Monica near the beach and promenade.
My ALLLL time favorite salad in the world is the Quinoa Arugula Salad with Salmon at CPK. I have visited this location twice after work and the service  has been great.
Food is delicious  Beers are great  Dessert amazing but Service...FANTASTIC! Love our server Marx!
Pad thai chicken pizza was too salty.   TV moniters played sports.  Fuck.  I want to watch Korean drama.
Sams service was on point!! Took great care of us on a to go order and gave my pup water. Stay awesome man!!

The staff is very friendly and courteous.  The restaurant is very clean and well maintained.  Food arrived at a very reasonable amount of time (no longer than 10 minutes). HOWEVER This isn't traditional pizza. It's a very watered down version of it. The crust is extremely thin and lacking mozarella on the traditional Pepperoni pizza. I also found the food to be lacking in taste.  If you decided to come here to get some good pizza, I suggest trying somewhere else.

Gone are the days of a mediocre, overpriced meal.  On a whim, we decided we'd give CPK a shot again, this after a VERY long break from it.  We were pleasantly surprised that the interior is set up really nicely.  They've also changed up their menu, while still keeping a lot of their classics... Bread and butter was also surprisingly good too.   Think this is going to be one of our regular dinner spots to mix into our rotation. :)

It's been awhile since my last review, so I thought I would write one today. We walked inside in between lunch and dinner so it was no problem getting a booth. The interior is revamped, remodeled! It looks clean, industrial, country chic. I ordered my favorite, the Thai Chicken Crunch salad because I love cabbage, crispy wontons and the Thai peanut sauce. My husband ordered the chicken piccata which looked really delicious and he said it was perfect! For dessert we ordered the butter cake with vanilla ice cream! The cake was moist and tasty! Service was efficient, friendly and professional. I like CPK for their consistency, and tasty food.

Portions are really stingy. I don't know why I keep ordering from there. The portions just get smaller and smaller each time. The asparagus and arugula salad was the stingiest. You get a handful of dry arugula and two 1-inch stumps of asparagus. What's going on CPK?  I think I've learned my lesson now. Never again.
